title: AssertionError: ReverseV2 is not known to be either linear or a supported non-linearity
body:
I built an model by using Keras with Tensorflow backend. However, it thrown an error. So I try to figure out the root cause. 

- Download and rerun the [sample Keras LSTM notebook](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/notebooks/deep_explainer/Keras%20LSTM%20for%20IMDB%20Sentiment%20Classification.ipynb) to isolate environment issue. So assuming environment is ok
- Current SHAP still support Keras 2.1.x. Although there is warning that SHAP support Keras >= 2.2.0, it seems that can still use SHAP with Keras 2.1.x by running sample notebook
- Comparing the difference between sample notebook Keras model and my model. The sample one is a Sequential model (<keras.models.Sequential at 0x7fd2d83706a0>) when mine is Keras's engine training model (<keras.engine.training.Model at 0x7f8f6e660cc0>). 

Added sample code in [github repo](https://github.com/makcedward/nlp/blob/master/sample/nlp-model_interpretation-201808.ipynb). Please kindly advise which part do I miss?

```
AssertionError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-10-dba880f8c9e3> in <module>()
----> 1 explainer = shap.DeepExplainer(pipeline.model, encoded_x_train[:10])
      2 shap_values = explainer.shap_values(encoded_x_test[:1])

/anaconda/envs/py35/lib/python3.5/site-packages/shap/explainers/deep.py in __init__(self, model, data, session)
    170                     assert self.num_variable_inputs(op) == 1, "GatherV2 can only have one varying input!"
    171                 else:
--> 172                     assert False, op.type + " is not known to be either linear or a supported non-linearity!"
    173 
    174         if not self.multi_output:

AssertionError: ReverseV2 is not known to be either linear or a supported non-linearity!
```
